title: MozAIc: Transparent Multi-AI Verification Engine on Cardano
summary: Institutions lack reliable ways to preserve & verify digital information and the reasoning behind it. Sources and AI outputs change or disappear, breaking reproducibility and accountable verification.
solution: MozAIc delivers independent multi-agent information analyses, preserves each agent’s reasoning in versioned bundles, and anchors a proof on Cardano for immutable, reproducible verification.

sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
**MozAIc introduces a practical, Cardano\-native approach to digital reasoning verification by capturing multiple model outputs, preserving their reasoning trails, and anchoring a reproducible evidence bundle on\-chain\. Its innovations are measurable and testable—for example, enabling direct comparison of several model positions per claim and creating timestamped, verifiable proofs on Cardano testnet or mainnet:**

**1\. Multi\-agent reasoning with distinct “positions”**

Unlike most AI systems that give a single verdict, MozAIc queries multiple AI models and preserves each model’s reasoning. This creates a fully traceable record of agreements, disagreements, and confidence levels.

**2\. Version\-preserved reasoning bundles:**

Every analysis is captured as a structured bundle linked to a timestamp on Cardano. This ensures that reasoning cannot be lost or altered, allowing institutions to reproduce and audit past decisions reliably.

**3\. Immutable timestamping for knowledge evolution**

Nothing like MozAIc currently anchors multi-agent reasoning, positions, and snapshots directly to Cardano. This allows institutions to prove:

•   the exact state of the information at the time

•   the timestamp attached to that state

•   how different models interpreted it

•   and how those interpretations evolved

**4\. Transparent provenance for AI outputs**

While other tools generate text, MozAIc generates traceable audit trails. Every output has verifiable lineage, including source claims, model states, reasoning chains, and time-stamped cryptographic proofs.

**5\. API\-first design for enterprise information\-integrity workflows**

Unlike existing AI fact-checkers or consumer chatbots, MozAIc is built for institutions that require:

•	auditability

•	reproducibility

•	regulatory compliance

•	cross-team alignment

•	defensible epistemic trails

This moves AI from unverifiable intuition to transparent institutional infrastructure.

**6\. A verification pipeline that can escalate to human review when needed**

This hybrid model is unique:

•	low-cost automated multi-agent analysis

•	selective human adjudication only for high-stakes ambiguity

Nothing on the market connects these layers into a unified workflow.

- - -


**In summary**

MozAIc is innovative because it transforms AI from a tool that generates unverifiable text into a system that produces cryptographically anchored, multi-agent, reproducible epistemic evidence.

There is no existing product, on-chain or off-chain, that delivers this combination of:

•	multi-agent positioning

•	transparent reasoning

•	immutable timestamping

•	institutional-grade reproducibility

•	open, auditable knowledge evolution

•	modular human-in-the-loop escalation

Unlike generic timestamping tools, MozAIc does not simply record a hash of a file, it preserves the full reasoning process, the positions of multiple models, and the complete evidence trail behind a conclusion.

And unlike AI fact-checkers that output unverifiable summaries, MozAIc produces replayable, version-preserved reasoning bundles that anyone can audit, reproduce, and anchor on-chain.

This is a new category of infrastructure:

Verification-as-a-protocol for institutions, AI systems, and the public.

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
**The MozAIc MVP will demonstrate a functioning end\-to\-end verification pipeline that shows how multi\-agent “positions,” transparent reasoning bundles, and immutable timestamping can be combined into a reproducible information\-integrity workflow\. The prototype will include:**

**1\. A working multi\-agent analysis engine**

A user submits a claim, text, or document.

Multiple AI models generate positions (not “verdicts”), each with preserved reasoning.

The system outputs a structured, side-by-side reasoning bundle.

**2\. Version\-preserved snapshots**

Every analysis is captured as a timestamped snapshot with:

•	model positions

•	reasoning chains

•	uncertainty markers

•	source mappings (when available)

**3\. Immutable Cardano anchoring**

The MVP will anchor a cryptographic proof of each analysis to Cardano testnet/mainnet.

This will demonstrate the ability to verify:

•	what was analyzed

•	when

•	by which agents

•	and what the reasoning contained

**4\. A simple web interface for institutional and developer testing**

**Users will be able to:**

•	submit text or claims

•	view the multi-agent positions

•	view the reasoning bundle

•	access the timestamped proof

•	download the structured analysis artifact

This interface will be intentionally minimal and focused on demonstrating the core workflow rather than the final UI design.

**5\. API access for developers**

The prototype will expose API endpoints that allow developers and institutions to integrate MozAIc’s verification pipeline into their own systems.

- - -


**Where it can be accessed**



•	Public Web Demo: A hosted version of the MVP (URL provided at launch)



•	GitHub Repository: Open-source codebase for the verification pipeline



•	Cardano Testnet/Mainnet: Anchored proofs viewable via Cardano explorers



•	API Documentation Portal: Developer-accessible endpoints and examples



All components will be publicly available so the community can test the workflow, inspect the code, and validate the timestamped outputs.

sub_fields.title: Describe realistic measures of success, ideally with on-chain metrics.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
**Success for the MozAIc Fund 15 prototype will be measured through a combination of user\-facing adoption metrics, developer usage metrics, and verifiable on\-chain activity generated by the timestamping layer\. These indicators demonstrate that MozAIc is functioning as an institutional\-grade verification engine anchored to Cardano\.**



**1\. On\-Chain Success Metrics \(Primary\)**



• Number of timestamped MozAIc proofs written to Cardano testnet/mainnet

Target: 500–1,000+ anchored proofs during the MVP phase.



Each proof represents:



•	a multi-agent reasoning bundle



•	a cryptographic hash



•	a preserved snapshot



• Distinct claim/analysis batches anchored on-chain

Target: 200–300 unique, user-submitted analyses recorded immutably.



• Verified retrieval of outputs via on-chain reference

Target: 95%+ retrievability rate through the Cardano explorer link or API.



• Open-source repository activity



Target:



•	20+ community interactions (stars, forks, issues)

•	5+ external contributions



These demonstrate developer adoption and transparency.



**2\. System\-Level Success Metrics \(Off\-chain/MVP internal\)**



• Multi-agent reasoning runs successfully processed

Target: 1,000+ successful multi-agent outputs through the pipeline.



• Latency benchmarks

Target: multi-agent results returned in under 8 seconds for typical inputs.



• Version-preserved reasoning bundles generated

Target: 1,000+ reasoning bundles created, stored, and retrievable.



• API usage by external testers

Target: 10+ developer teams integrating or testing API endpoints.



• Institutional/enterprise pilot testers

Target: 2–3 early testers (journalism groups, research teams, Cardano community leaders).

________________________________________

**3\. Adoption & Usability Success Metrics**



• MVP web interface users

Target: 100–300 unique users within the pilot phase.



• Repeat usage rate

Target: 30–40% of users returning to submit more claims.



• User satisfaction feedback

Target: 4.0+/5.0 average rating from feedback surveys.

________________________________________

**4\. Open Knowledge Ecosystem Success Metrics**



These metrics matter because MozAIc is not only a tool; it establishes a foundation for future open, decentralized knowledge infrastructure.



• Publicly accessible snapshot library created

Target: One open repository containing all timestamped snapshots for public audit.



• Reproducibility demonstrations

Target: 3–5 analyses redone over time to demonstrate timestamped evolution of knowledge.

________________________________________

**5\. Post\-MVP Forward Metrics \(Not delivered in Fund 15 but essential to signal\)**



•	Scaling from testnet → mainnet anchoring



•	API integrations across multiple agent models



•	First prototype of extended knowledge-recording layer



•	First enterprise partner using timestamped proofs

Including these forward markers shows reviewers that you have a credible long-term path beyond the MVP.

_

**Success is measured by the volume and reliability of MozAIc’s on\-chain timestamped proofs, the number of successfully processed multi\-agent reasoning bundles, developer adoption of the API, and broad public use of the MVP interface\.**

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
**MozAIc solves the core problem—the disappearance, mutation, and unverifiability of digital knowledge—by creating a cryptographically anchored, multi\-agent verification pipeline that preserves the original informational context, its timestamp, and the reasoning used to interpret it\.**



**1\. Multi\-agent “positions” instead of single\-model answers**

MozAIc uses multiple AI systems to generate parallel positions on any submitted claim, document, statement, or dataset.



Each position includes:



•	the model’s reasoning



•	its uncertainties



•	its source references



•	its interpretive path



**This creates transparency where today there is only opaque AI output\.**



**2\. Version\-preserved reasoning bundles**

Every multi-agent analysis is captured as a structured “reasoning bundle” that can be inspected, replayed, and compared over time.



This allows institutions, journalists, researchers, and auditors to see:



•	how models converged or diverged



•	why their interpretations differed



•	how those interpretations evolve over time



**This addresses the reproducibility and “memory\-hole” problem\.**



**3\. Immutable timestamping on Cardano**

A cryptographic hash of each reasoning bundle is anchored to Cardano.

This establishes:



•	proof that the bundle existed at that moment



•	proof that it has not been altered



•	a verifiable audit trail



•	a permanent reference for dispute resolution



**This brings cryptographic guarantees to AI\-assisted knowledge\.**



**4\. Transparent provenance for institutional workflows**

Institutions struggle to justify or defend decisions that rely on AI or digital documents.

MozAIc outputs:



•	a human-readable, versioned report



•	the underlying reasoning



•	the timestamped proof



**This gives organizations a defensible, reproducible epistemic trail\.**



**5\. API\-first architecture for broad adoption**

The MVP includes an API that lets institutions integrate MozAIc into their existing claims processes, research workflows, or data-review systems.



**6\. Public\-facing interface for open testing**

A simple web interface allows users to:



•	submit text or claims



•	view multi-agent positions



•	download the reasoning bundle



•	verify the on-chain timestamp



**This demonstrates the system’s end\-to\-end workflow\.**



**7\. Foundation for the BO Vellum \(future phase\)**

While not part of the Fund 15 scope, MozAIc also serves as the verification substrate for a permanent, decentralized knowledge mesh that will ensure historical entries cannot be deleted, altered, or rewritten without leaving an on-chain trail.

________________________________________

**In summary**



MozAIc provides an actionable, technically feasible solution to digital knowledge instability by combining multi-agent reasoning, version-preserved outputs, and Cardano’s immutable ledger.



Today, AI often behaves like a black box: answers appear and disappear with no durable record of how they were produced. MozAIc instead preserves the reasoning behind those answers and timestamps it on Cardano, making AI outputs traceable and auditable over time

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
**MozAIc strengthens the Cardano ecosystem by providing the one capability Cardano currently lacks: a native, verifiable, tamper\-proof way to anchor evidence, reasoning, and institutional knowledge on\-chain\. This directly benefits the community by creating a reusable “information\-integrity layer” that any dApp, research group, SPO, developer team, or community project can build on\.**

By producing open, audit-ready snapshots of claims, documents, and AI outputs that are permanently stored on Cardano, MozAIc enables:

•	transparent provenance for community research and governance

•	verifiable audit trails for Catalyst proposals, milestones, and deliverables

•	new categories of dApps that require proof-of-knowledge or timestamped reasoning

•	stronger trust guarantees for Cardano content creators, educators, and analysts

•	open infrastructure that the entire ecosystem can integrate without permission

MozAIc turns Cardano into the blockchain where facts, reasoning, and institutional records can be permanently anchored and independently verified. This unlocks new technical possibilities, strengthens community trust, and elevates Cardano as a leader in decentralized information integrity, which is an increasingly critical category in global digital infrastructure.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
**Capability to Deliver:**



MozAIc is developed by a combined team with proven delivery records in blockchain engineering, AI systems, and Cardano-native development. Our technical partner, Zaytrics, has delivered secure smart contracts, decentralized applications, and zero-knowledge proof systems across multiple L1 ecosystems, including Cardano. Their engineering team includes senior Haskell developers, backend architects, and AI/agent-orchestration specialists.

 

**Feasibility of the Approach:**



The architecture is intentionally simple at its foundation: a minimal Plutus notary contract anchoring an off-chain reasoning bundle stored via IPFS/CID. The multi-agent comparison and version-preserved provenance layers operate entirely off-chain, eliminating cost and complexity while keeping the design modular and upgrade-ready. We validate feasibility through a working prototype built in incremental stages—first anchoring single-agent proofs, then extending to multi-agent bundles, and finally enabling version-preserved replay. Each stage includes functional tests, load tests, and reproducibility checks to ensure the system behaves predictably and auditably.



**Verification & Testing:**



– Multi-model consistency checks



– CID retrieval and verification



– Cross-version reasoning drift detection



– On-chain anchor validation on Cardano testnet



– Security review for data integrity and tamper resistance



We will publish results openly through GitHub commits, versioned test reports, and weekly build updates.

Why Reviewers Can Trust Delivery:



The scope of the Fund 15 prototype is deliberately right-sized. The on-chain component is a minimal Plutus notary contract—small, deterministic, and inexpensive to run—while all heavy computation and multi-model reasoning occur off-chain. As a result, the 12-month plan focuses on integration, testing, validation, and hardening rather than speculative R&D. This alignment keeps the project feasible, low-risk, and fully achievable within the requested budget and timeline.



The contract footprint is intentionally minimal and the off-chain architecture avoids expensive or experimental dependencies. The entire system is modular, open-source, and well-documented, allowing any Cardano-literate team to maintain or extend it. With a proven engineering partner and a validated architecture, MozAIc is fully capable of delivering a robust, auditable prototype within the requested funding and timeline.

sub_fields.answer: Architecture, Specification & Repo Setup

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
The first milestone establishes the complete technical foundation for MozAIc. During this phase, we produce the full system architecture for the multi-agent reasoning pipeline, including detailed specifications for how each AI agent is queried, how responses are captured, and how divergence is mapped across agents. We also design the initial version of the version-preserved reasoning bundle schema, defining how reasoning, evidence, uncertainties, and metadata are structured so bundles remain replayable and comparable over time.



In parallel, we finalize the anchoring workflow design for Cardano testnet, detailing how hashes are derived, submitted, verified, and retrieved to support provenance and chronology. The public GitHub repository is initialized with project structure, documentation scaffolding, coding standards, test plans, and issue templates.

This milestone ensures the project begins with a coherent, auditable blueprint, giving Catalyst reviewers, developers, and institutional users visibility into the system’s logic before implementation begins.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
Milestone 1 is accepted when the full architectural foundation of MozAIc is complete, internally consistent, and publicly documented. The multi-agent reasoning pipeline must be fully specified, including the definition of independent agent query paths, formatting requirements for agent outputs, handling of uncertainties, and the standard process for extracting reasoning trails. The initial version-preserved reasoning bundle schema must be created, defining all required fields (reasoning, evidence mapping, agent metadata, version metadata, and reproducibility requirements). The specification must be detailed enough that another developer could begin implementing the engine without ambiguity.



The anchoring workflow design must clearly outline how reasoning bundles are hashed, how hashes are prepared for submission, what metadata is included, how on-chain transaction IDs are referenced, and how users verify bundle integrity. This includes defining testnet endpoints, transaction structures, verification steps, and fallback logic.



The public GitHub repository must be initialized and contain:

• a project structure aligned with planned milestones

• an architecture overview

• the schema definition (v1)

• coding standards and contribution guidelines

• an initial test plan

• a roadmap for subsequent milestones



All components must be clearly documented, coherent, and ready for implementation in Milestone 2.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
Completion of Milestone 1 will be demonstrated through a fully populated public GitHub repository containing all architectural documents, schemas, diagrams, and specifications. The repository will include a finalized multi-agent pipeline specification detailing how each agent is queried, how outputs are normalized, how divergences are identified, and how reasoning is extracted and structured. A completed reasoning-bundle schema v1 will be included as a machine-readable JSON Schema (or equivalent), along with human-readable documentation explaining each field and versioning logic.



The anchoring workflow documentation will be present as a dedicated markdown file or folder containing step-by-step descriptions of hash derivation, testnet submission procedures, verification queries, and mapping of anchored proofs back to reasoning bundles.



GitHub commit history will show that the documents were created during the milestone period, including diagrams, text files, or documentation updates. The repo will also contain a milestone 1 README summarizing what has been completed.



To verify transparency and feasibility, Catalyst reviewers will be able to view:

• architectural diagrams

• the bundle schema v1

• anchoring workflow documentation

• initial test plans

• public issue tracker entries related to Milestone 1



This confirms Milestone 1 is fully delivered and ready for implementation work in Milestone 2.

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
The second milestone delivers the working core of MozAIc: the multi-agent reasoning engine. This includes implementing independent query paths for multiple AI agents (3–4 models), capturing their reasoning outputs, extracting structured evidence, and standardizing the representation of reasoning trails. The engine produces clear comparisons between agents, exposing where interpretations converge, diverge, or express uncertainty.

We also implement reproducible run logging, ensuring every analysis run can be replayed, versioned, and audited. Internal test harnesses validate the stability of prompts, formatting, and error-handling across agents, preserving reliability even as external models change.



A key output of this milestone is a functioning end-to-end pipeline: input → multi-agent runs → reasoning extraction → structured bundle → logged output. While this is not yet anchored to Cardano, it produces complete reasoning bundles ready for hashing and submission in the next milestone.



Evidence will include GitHub code, demonstration runs, early test bundles, documentation, and internal performance checks confirming that multi-agent reasoning operates consistently and predictably.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
Milestone 2 is accepted when the core multi-agent reasoning engine is fully implemented, stable, and capable of generating independent analyses from several AI agents (minimum 3–4). Each agent must operate through its own query path, with standardized prompt handling, output formatting, and structured reasoning extraction. The system must reliably capture reasoning trails, evidence references, uncertainties, and conclusion paths across all participating agents.



A foundational requirement is the ability to generate structured, machine-readable reasoning bundles, based on the schema defined in Milestone 1. These bundles must include: agent metadata, timestamps, reasoning trails, extracted evidence, uncertainty markers, divergence signals, and version identifiers. All bundles must be reproducible through logged parameters, ensuring the same input yields the same bundle structure under stable model conditions.



The engine must implement internal divergence mapping, enabling reviewers to see where agents agree, disagree, or express uncertainty. Logging must track model versions, prompts, and run metadata. Error-handling paths must ensure that partial failures or API inconsistencies do not break overall execution.



Finally, an internal test harness must be created to run repeated analyses, validate formatting consistency, handle rate-limit behavior, and ensure stable execution across multiple runs.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
Completion will be demonstrated through a working end-to-end implementation hosted in the public GitHub repository. Reviewers will be able to run or inspect code that performs multi-agent analysis, generates structured reasoning bundles, and logs reproducible metadata for each run.



The repository will contain:

• a fully implemented reasoning engine module

• standardized agent-query handlers for 3–4 models

• divergence mapping logic

• reproducible run-logging with timestamps and parameters

• unit tests and integration tests validating behavior



Sample reasoning bundles will be published in the repo, showing each agent’s reasoning trail, extracted evidence, divergent interpretations, uncertainties, and metadata. These bundles will match the schema and structural requirements defined in Milestone 1.



A demonstration script or notebook will allow Catalyst reviewers to run a multi-agent analysis locally (or through a simple CLI) and view the structured bundle output. Logs must show stable output formatting across multiple runs.



Internal test results will be published documenting formatting stability, rate-limit handling, expected latency ranges, and error-handling behavior. Commit histories will confirm the milestone was implemented during the expected window.



Successful delivery of this evidence confirms Milestone 2 is complete and the system is ready for Cardano anchoring integration in Milestone 3.

The third milestone integrates the reasoning engine with the Cardano testnet anchoring layer, enabling immutable proof-of-existence and chronology. This includes implementing the hash-generation pipeline for reasoning bundles, submitting hashes to Cardano testnet, verifying transaction IDs, and exposing an endpoint that allows users to confirm the integrity of a bundle against the chain.



We also build the public REST API, enabling developers, researchers, and Catalyst reviewers to submit claims, receive multi-agent analyses, retrieve reasoning bundles, and verify their corresponding on-chain proofs.



A lightweight web demo interface is implemented to visualize reasoning bundles, display cross-agent differences, and show anchoring metadata. This interface is not intended as a consumer product but as a clear demonstration of MozAIc’s core functions for reviewers and ecosystem developers.



Performance testing (latency, throughput, and reliability across repeated runs) is conducted to ensure the system behaves predictably as the number of anchored proofs increases.



Evidence includes live demo access, testnet transaction IDs, API documentation, reasoning bundle examples, and public GitHub commits.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
Milestone 3 is accepted when MozAIc’s off-chain reasoning engine is fully integrated with a functional Cardano testnet anchoring layer and a publicly accessible API and demonstration interface are available. The anchoring layer must allow reasoning bundles generated in Milestone 2 to be hashed, submitted to Cardano testnet, and referenced through verifiable transaction IDs. The workflow must include hash derivation requirements, transaction submission logic, and a verification method enabling users to confirm that a reasoning bundle matches its on-chain anchor.



A public REST API must be implemented, providing endpoints to:

• submit a claim or document for multi-agent analysis

• retrieve the generated reasoning bundle

• retrieve the bundle’s corresponding hash

• check the on-chain transaction and confirm anchoring

• access run metadata and timestamps



The API must include rate limiting, error handling, and documented request/response formats.



A web-based demo interface must be built to display reasoning bundles, cross-agent comparisons, divergence summaries, and anchored proof metadata. This interface should not be a consumer product but a clear, functional demonstration allowing reviewers, researchers, and developers to evaluate MozAIc’s operation.



Performance testing is required to validate bundle-generation latency, anchoring throughput, and API reliability under repeated load. All components must operate end-to-end: input → multi-agent analysis → bundle → hash → anchor → verification.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
Evidence includes a live, functioning Cardano testnet integration where reviewers can submit reasoning bundle hashes and view the corresponding testnet transaction IDs. The public GitHub repository will contain all code required to derive hashes, submit them to testnet, retrieve transaction details, and verify bundle integrity. Documentation will outline the anchoring workflow, verification procedure, and expected behaviors.



A running public API will be provided with full documentation (OpenAPI/Swagger or equivalent) describing available endpoints, parameters, response schemas, and usage examples. Reviewers will be able to submit a test claim, trigger a multi-agent analysis, retrieve the resulting reasoning bundle, and confirm that the bundle’s hash is anchored on Cardano testnet.



A lightweight web demo will be publicly accessible, enabling reviewers to visualize reasoning outputs, divergence across agents, and anchored proof links. The interface will display bundle metadata, hash values, and clickable testnet transaction references.



Internal performance test results will be published to confirm stable anchoring throughput, consistent API latency, and reliability over repeated calls. GitHub commit history and issues associated with the milestone will confirm time-bounded delivery.



These materials collectively demonstrate full integration of the reasoning engine, anchoring layer, and user-facing access points.

A comprehensive Final Project Report must be completed, describing the full architecture, implementation approach, reasoning-bundle schema, anchoring workflow, API design, testing methodology, performance results, known limitations, and recommendations for post-MVP development.



A final demo video must walk reviewers step-by-step through the functioning system, including: submitting a claim, initiating a multi-agent analysis, viewing the structured reasoning bundle, checking multi-agent divergences, retrieving the hash, and verifying the corresponding on-chain testnet transaction. The project must also deliver between 500 and 1,000+ anchored proofs, generated during testing, development, and public evaluation. All code, schemas, documentation, and test procedures must be fully published in the open-source repository with clear instructions for running the system locally.

This milestone is accepted when the public repo, final report, demo video, and anchored-proof dataset demonstrate a completed, stable, and reproducible MVP.

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
**MozAIc delivers exceptional value to the Cardano ecosystem by providing a missing piece of core infrastructure: a standardized, immutable, audit\-grade framework for anchoring digital reasoning, multi\-model analysis, and versioned provenance on\-chain\.**



**Cardano as the foundation of verifiable knowledge**



Cardano’s decentralized governance, deterministic ledger, and long-term durability make it uniquely suited to anchor reasoning trails, evidence bundles, and historical states. MozAIc is intentionally designed around Cardano’s strengths: transparent governance, predictable fees, formal verification culture, and immutable, replayable on-chain history.



This is the core of MozAIc’s value—not an add-on. Cardano provides the permanence, neutrality, and public trust that make an information-integrity engine workable.



**A new Cardano\-native integrity layer**



MozAIc establishes the first framework on Cardano capable of anchoring:



•	immutable reasoning bundles



•	multi-model analysis and versioned snapshots



•	standardized provenance schemas



•	timestamped institutional evidence



•	replayable historical states



•	public and enterprise verification tools



These primitives enable scientific, legal, public-sector, and commercial applications that Cardano cannot currently support without this infrastructure.



**High\-leverage architecture with minimal chain load**



MozAIc anchors only essential metadata on-chain while performing heavy computation off-chain, delivering security and auditability at low cost.



This approach keeps fees predictable and minimizes network load while still providing the high-assurance guarantees enterprise and public-sector users expect.



**Benefits for institutions and the public**



By anchoring authoritative informational states and their associated reasoning at specific points in time, MozAIc turns Cardano into a verifiable history substrate.



This supports:



•	institutional compliance and regulatory auditability



•	reproducible scientific and analytical work



•	public transparency and accountability



•	multi-lingual, global access to recorded states



This positions Cardano as the public infrastructure layer for durable, verifiable knowledge.



**A practical, deliverable prototype**



Fund 15 finances a complete, testable integrity engine including:



•	a Plutus-based notary contract



•	multi-model analysis pipeline



•	version-preserving snapshot system



•	browser interface + retrieval tools



•	Cardano testnet integration



•	audit-ready documentation



These deliverables create an immediately useful primitive that developers, researchers, institutions, and future builders can adopt.



**A strategic foundation for future innovation**



MozAIc establishes the base layer for:



•	decentralized knowledge archives



•	AI audit and compliance systems



•	scientific verification tools



•	institutional timestamping



•	long-term public recordkeeping



•	privacy layers (future Midnight compatibility)



For a contained Fund 15 budget, MozAIc provides a low-risk, high-impact, high-leverage contribution that expands Cardano’s role in the fast-growing information-integrity market.
